history.content: The advisors can definitely follow up, but according to the official schedule on the EECS website (https://www2.eecs.berkeley.edu/Scheduling/CS/schedule-next.html), its just Prof. Russell.

children.subject: dang I was looking forward to 188. What website are those reviews from btw?

Do your research better. Russell wrote AIMA with Peter Norvig. That is like the Bible of AI. I would not discard the possibility of taking 188 with a guy that wrote a primary reference for the field just because 2 people gave a bad review on Ninja Courses
dang I'll take it then! I don't mind the heavy emphasis on math/statistics tbh

Yes yes I'm sure he's the master of the field, but it would mean little to me if I'm not capable of learning from his teaching style. Such case has happened to me too many times when I took classes from a certain department (not EECS).
I am sure you can check the webcasts from when he taught the course on webcast.berkeley.edu. What you find might change your mind maybe.

I understand. I just wanted to make sure that you knew who really is teaching the class. Aside, check the projects. If you find them fun you might still want to take it with him even if he is a bad lecturer as long as you can see another Professor's lecturer (assuming big overlap over material). I have heard that Abbeel is pretty good (haven't taken the course myself so would not be able to tell). He is also very influential in the field and will be teaching it over the Spring (when I will take it)
This is obviously assuming that the projects are different depending from each offering*
Abbeel is an amazing instructor. I learned 188 on ai.berkeley.edu in high school and he changed my life :)
I'm thinking of taking 188 next semester, what's wrong with Russell?

history.content:
Thanks for noting the inconsistency.  The current plan is for it to be co-taught by Profs Russell and Klein, but I've been told that this might change. (I have no more information on how or what chances are.)

 Note: https://www2.eecs.berkeley.edu/Scheduling/CS/schedule-next.html feeds from the campus schedule so isn't a separate data point the way the draft schedule is.  The dept draft schedule and the campus online schedule should, of course, share the same information.

Hi all,

On the department website's 2018-19 draft, both professors Klein and Russell are listed as instructors for Fall 2018 CS 188. However, on the cal central enrollment, only professor Russell is listed. Can someone please confirm that both Klein and Russell will be teaching, please?

I've heard that 188 with professor Russell is very different from 188 with other professors, and I probably don't want to take it with professor Russell.

Thank you
history.subject: Fall 2018 CS 188 instructor(s)

history.content:
